Dicap Polisi Arogan soal Razia Tambang Ilegal, Kasatpol PP Babel: Sah Saja
03 Nov 2019, 14:45 by Deni Wahyono
Belitung - Kepala Satuan Polisi Pamong Praja Bangka Belitung Yamoa'a Harefa tidak mempermasalahkan pihaknya disebut arogan saat menertibkan tambang timah ilegal. Yamoa'a Harefa pun menanggapi hal tersebut dengan santai.
"Ya sah-sah saja mereka ngomong seperti itu," jelas Yamoa'a Harefa kepada detikcom, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Namun Yamoa'a Harefa tidak mau berkomentar terlalu banyak terkait hal tersebut. Pihaknya saat ini sedang membuat kronologis kejadian penertiban tambang timah ilegal di aliran Sungai Sengkelik, Desa Sijuk, Kecamatan Sijuk, Kabupaten Belitung.
"Saat ini kita sedang membuat kronologis kejadian keseluruhan, sedang kita susun semuanya," tambahnya.
Sebelumnya, pihak kepolisian menyayangkan penertiban tambang timah ilegal di Kecamatan Sijuk, Kabupaten Belitung, Provinsi Bangka Belitung, berakhir ricuh. Polisi menyebut kericuhan ini terjadi karena Satpol PP yang bertindak arogan.
"Berawal dari penertiban yang dilakukan Satpol PP Provinsi Babel yang arogan dengan membakar mesin TI (tambang inkonvensional) milik para penambang sebanyak 20 set," jelas Kapolres Belitung AKBP Yudhis Wibisana saat dimintai konfirmasi detikcom, Minggu (3/11).
Meskipun demikian, usai kerusuhan saat penertiban tambang timah ilegal di Kabupaten Belitung, kini kondisi di tempat kejadian sudah berangsur kondusif.

Arogan Police Labeled Illegal Mining Raids, Kasatpol PP Babel: Legitimate
03 Nov 2019, 14:45 by Deni Wahyono
Belitung - Head of the Bangka Belitung Civil Service Police Unit, Yamoa'a Harefa, does not question that his party is called arrogant when controlling illegal tin mines. Yamoa'a Harefa also responded to it casually.
"Yes, it is fine for them to talk like that," explained Yamoa'a Harefa to AFP on Sunday (3/11/2019).
But Yamoa'a Harefa did not want to comment too much about it. He said he was currently making a chronology of the events of controlling illegal tin mines in the Sakitik River, Sijuk Village, Sijuk District, Belitung Regency.
"At the moment we are making a chronology of the whole event, we are putting it all together," he added.
Previously, the police regretted the control of illegal tin mining in Sijuk District, Belitung Regency, Bangka Belitung Province, which ended in chaos. The police said the riots occurred because Satpol PP was acting arrogantly.
"Starting with policing by the arrogant Babel Province Satpol PP by burning miners (unconventional mines) owned by miners as many as 20 sets," explained Belitung Police Chief AKBP Yudhis Wibisana when asked to confirm AFP on Sunday (3/11).
Even so, after the riots when controlling illegal tin mines in Belitung Regency, the conditions at the scene are now gradually conducive.
